intro: Hieracium salticola, commonly known as the jumping harebell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are hairy and alternate along the stem, and the plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. Hieracium salticola is adapted to cold climates and is often found in high-altitude meadows.
